msfastar 0.8.0
  • Reference

    Get/Set the FASTA meta data regex

    regex.Rd

    regex() gets and sets the current regex patters to assist the read_fasta() function. This simply provides the structure needed to read_fasta the fasta file, a custom list can also be supplied. To set elements in the regex() function, simply provide a list with complementary names to over-write the current list.

    Usage

    regex(params = NULL)

    Arguments

    params

    A list of the meta data to be extracted from the fasta file

    Example:

    list(
  "accession" = "(?<=|)[A-Z0-9]{5,12}",
  "protein_name" = "(?<=|)[A-Z0-9\\_]{8,}(?=\\s)",
  "gene_name" = "(?<=GN\\=).*?(?=\\s..\\=)",
  "organism" = "(?<=OS\\=).*?(?=\\s..\\=)",
  "description" = "(?<=\\s).*?(?=\\s..\\=)",
  "sequence" = "[A-Z]"
)

    Examples

    library(msfastar)
regex()
#> $accession
#> [1] "(?<=|)[A-Z0-9]{5,12}"
#> 
#> $protein_name
#> [1] "(?<=|)[A-Z0-9\\_]{8,}(?=\\s)"
#> 
#> $gene_name
#> [1] "(?<=GN\\=).*?(?=\\s..\\=)"
#> 
#> $organism
#> [1] "(?<=OS\\=).*?(?=\\s..\\=)"
#> 
#> $description
#> [1] "(?<=\\s).*?(?=\\s..\\=)"
#> 
#> $sequence
#> [1] "[A-Z]"
#> 

regex(list("accession" = "sp\\|[A-Z]"))
#> $accession
#> [1] "sp\\|[A-Z]"
#> 
#> $protein_name
#> [1] "(?<=|)[A-Z0-9\\_]{8,}(?=\\s)"
#> 
#> $gene_name
#> [1] "(?<=GN\\=).*?(?=\\s..\\=)"
#> 
#> $organism
#> [1] "(?<=OS\\=).*?(?=\\s..\\=)"
#> 
#> $description
#> [1] "(?<=\\s).*?(?=\\s..\\=)"
#> 
#> $sequence
#> [1] "[A-Z]"
#>
